snippet: Advance planning for care at the end of life may finally be about to overcome politics, as insurers begin to pay for the discussions.
abstract: Editorial welcomes fact that some private and public insurers have begun paying doctors to have end-of-life discussions with their patients; contends advanced planning ensures that patients make decisions for themselves when they are of sound mind and also gives doctors and nurses critical information about kind of care desired.
lead_paragraph: Advance planning for care at the end of life may finally be about to overcome politics, as insurers begin to pay for the discussions.
